alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 06 at 12:30AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: .Water levels on the Mendenhall have crested and are starting to recede. Record flooding and significant bank erosion is still occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...The Mendenhall Lake and River around the glacier visitor center, the Mendenhall campground, Skaters Cabin Road, View Drive, Meander Way, and below Back Loop bridge. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Record high flooding is occurring, however the river has crested and is starting to recede. Flooding is being reported in areas that have not previously seen flooding before. Significant bank erosion is also occurring with reports of structures starting to collapse into the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:17 PM AKDT, Water levels have crested on the Mendenhall Lake and River. Water levels reached a crest of 14.97 feet around 11:15 PM Saturday evening well above the previous record stage of 12.0 feet set in 2016. Water levels are starting to recede but flooding is expected to continue for several more hours. Water levels are currently at 14.71 feet which is over the major flood stage of 14.0 feet and is currently falling. Flooding is being reported in areas that have not previously seen flooding before, like around Meander Way, and Diamond Park. Significant bank erosion with structures collapsing into the river has been observed as well. A few structure have been lost to the river. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 12:15am the stage was 14.71 feet. Major Flood Stage is 14.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 17.97 feet was observed at 11:15 pm Saturday evening. The water level is expected to quickly drop overnight. Impacts: At 10.9 feet: View Drive will be flooded and impassable with significant flooding to some homes in the area. Locations below back loop bridge will begin to see flooding of some yards, significant bank erosion along with hazardous navigation from debris in the river. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - If you live near or along the Mendenhall River, stay alert and be prepared to take action. - The US Coast Guard recommends that mariners use caution when transiting the affected area and be aware of significant debris in the water.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
